content.description: Looking at the obvious prow, start low in the mini-cave. You will find a huge hollowed out area that resembles the interior of a paper wasp's nest. Start matched inside the cave, and work your way out to the front of the prow, over the bulge, and over the ridge.The opening move out of the mini-cave is a little tricky as is getting over the bulge and getting your feet out of the cave. Once you get your feet over the bulge, it's easy, less-than-vertical movement over the prow. This is a really awesome climb despite only having a few moves.
content.location: It is in the mini-cave below the obvious prow.

content.description: Wasp Prow is a small, prow-like boulder right near the popular Berlin Boulder (to the north). Don't be fooled by its short stature, the 8 foot boulder has an awesome, low starting climb in a mini-cave.Note: the boulder is not named for a wasp's nest but an awesome start hold that resembles that of a paper wasp's nest
